item.title: Bleed Air Pressure Regulating Valve (PRV) Systems – PRV Closed and FAV INTERMEDIATELY OPEN

remarks.para: One may be inoperative with associated PRV secured closed provided:

numlitem.para: Associated fan air valve is secured in the intermediate open position,
Aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions,
L and R ISLN valves are open for takeoff, and when flaps are operated,
Bleed systems on remaining engine are operative,
Associated ENGINE BLEED switch is select OFF except for engine start,
For GE, associated engine thrust reverser is deactivated, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

operation.para: Advisory message BLEED_OVHT/PRV may be displayed.

numlitem.para: For the associated engine, select Engine Bleed OFF except for ground engine start and when bleed air is required for inflight start.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted since L and R ISLN Valves must remain open during takeoff.

The associated engine’s thrust reverser is deactivated. The REV amber indication and EICAS message ENG_REVERSER may be displayed for the engine with reverser deactivated. Use symmetrical reverse thrust as required.

Thrust Reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engine will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operation.

During takeoff and for all flap operations, ensure that the L and R ISLN valves switches are in the open position. This assures air is available for operation of the air-driven hydraulic demand pump and LE flaps in the event of an adjacent engine shutdown.
Do not select associated engine Nacelle Anti-Ice Switch ON. If icing conditions are inadvertently encountered, reducing thrust on affected engine will minimize possible damage if ice is ingested.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.
Reduce takeoff and landing limited weights by 2,200 lbs.
Reduce en route climb limited weight by 3,200 lbs.
Increase flight planning fuel by 0.3%.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ PRV INOP CLOSED", "ENG FV INOP INTERMEDIATE OPEN" and " ___ TR INOP". Placard adjacent to associated Bleed Air SYS FAULT Light (P5 Panel): "SYS FAULT LIGHT INOP". Placard the associated engine Nacelle Anti-Ice Valve Switch (P5 Panel): "INOP - LEAVE OFF". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: BLEED AIR PRESSURE REGULATING VALVE (PRV) SYSTEMS
maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: The Pressure Regulating Valve and the High Pressure Shutoff Valve (MEL Item 36-11-3) are the same part number and can be interchanged.

numlitem.para: To dispatch with the associated PRV closed:

note.para: The PRV is installed forward of the precooler in the 1:00 o’clock position on GE CF6-80C series engines.

numlitem.para: Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Remove locking pin screw from the PRV actuator cap. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from locking pin screw.
Rotate the hex for manual operation to the valve CLOSED position.
Install the locking pin screw in the switch actuating lever to lock the PRV in the CLOSED position.
Close the thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Secure the associated Fan Air Valve (FAV) in the intermediate open position as follows:
Open the left thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).

note.para: The FAV is installed on the left side of the precooler. The valve is spring-loaded open and is controlled by the Fan Air Temperature sensors. It has a locking crank to permit the valve to be operated manually.

numlitem.para: Remove the positioning screw from the FAV actuator housing. Remove and discard the O-ring. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from the positioning screw.
Turn the locking crank to the 45 degree position.
Install the positioning screw in the locking crank until it is engaged with the switch bracket. This will lock the valve in the 45 degree position.
Close the thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Deactivate the associated thrust reverser per MEL 78-31-1-1.
